arts.ttl: Emiliano Buendia savours ‘special night’ as captain helps Aston Villa through
arts.sum: Buendia’s header was added to by Jhon Duran in a 2-1 Carabao Cup win over Wycombe.

arts.ttl: Emi Buendia opens up on 'special' Aston Villa return after Wycombe landmark
arts.sum: Emi Buendia admits it was a "special night" for him at Wycombe after marking his first start in over 16 months with a goal to help Aston Villa progress in the Carabao Cup. He did feature for Villa's Under-21s against Fleetwood Town at the start of September, captaining the side and scoring twice, but did it for the first-team tonight in the Carabao Cup third round clash with Wycombe.
Highlights of the Carabao Cup third round tie between Wycombe Wanderers and Aston Villa.

arts.ttl: Aston Villa player ratings after 2-1 win at Wycombe in Carabao Cup
arts.sum: Joe Gauci and Kadan Young both enjoyed full debuts, while Emery also started youngsters Kosta Nedeljkovic, Lamare Bogarde and Sil Swinkels. Amadou Onana, Ian Maatsen and Duran aren't much older, while Ross Barkley, Leon Bailey and Buendia also started.

arts.ttl: Emiliano Buendia and Jhon Duran steer Aston Villa into Carabao Cup fourth round
arts.sum: Richard Kone pulled a stoppage-time goal back for League One Wycombe.

arts.ttl: Buendia scores on comeback as Villa avoid scare at Wycombe
arts.sum: Emi Buendia scored on his first Aston Villa start since May 2023 as Unai Emery's side avoided a scare to earn a 2-1 win at Wycombe in the Carabao Cup third round.

arts.ttl: Emiliano Buendia and Jhon Duran steer Aston Villa into Carabao Cup fourth round
arts.sum: Richard Kone pulled a stoppage-time goal back for League One Wycombe.

Fixtures Wycombe Wanderers Vs. Aston Villa - Tue, Sep 24th 2024, 20:00 Goals from Emi Buendía and Jhon Durán helped Aston Villa past Wycombe Wanderers to reach the fourth round of the Carabao Cup. On his first senior start since May 2023, Buendía broke the home side’s resistance when he netted a clever looping header after 55 minutes. Progression to round four for the first time since 2020 was secured when Durán won and scored a spot kick with five minutes remaining, rendering Richard Kone’s stoppage-time strike a consolation. Debuts for Joe Gauci and youngsters Kadan Young, Aidan Borland, Ben Broggio, Travis Patterson and Jamaldeen Jimoh-Aloba ensured it was a proud night for the Academy. Victory also saw Unai Emery become the fastest Villa manager to reach 50 wins, bringing up the milestone in his 90th game and overhauling Joe Mercer, who managed the feat in 93 matches. The two clubs had met twice before in the League Cup, with the last time seeing Villa emerge 8-3 victors in a crazy clash in Buckinghamshire 19 years ago. Emery made 10 changes from Saturday’s win against Wolves, handing debuts to Gauci and Young, with Sil Swinkels making his first appearance since an FA Cup debut in 2021. The red-hot Durán had a chance to open the scoring after just 37 seconds but slid a shot narrowly wide after latching onto Leon Bailey’s through ball. League One Wycombe had won five of their past six games and they threatened early on via Keiran Sadlier and Beryly Lubala. The tempo of the match slowed after an energetic opening, with the visitors exercising greater control but struggling to open the hosts up. Durán and Matt Butcher each sent an effort wide before the break as the sides headed back down the tunnel on level terms. Wanderers midfielder Butcher saw a shot deflected wide in the opening attack of the second half, galvanising the home fans behind Gauci’s goal. But their excitement was quelled when Villa netted with their first shot on target after 55 minutes. Young drove at his full-back on the left-hand side and reached the byline before pulling back a cross that flicked off a defender and on to the head of Buendía, who looped his effort beyond Franco Ravizzoli. Borland came on for his debut alongside Jacob Ramsey as the 17-year-old was rewarded for his strong performances in the Under-21s. Wycombe had struggled offensively since their exertions at the start of the half but they created two fine chances as the game ticked towards the final ten minutes. Both fell to Garath McCleary, who miskicked when he looked set to tap Cameron Humphreys’ cross home before calling Gauci into a five save from a header. Those missed opportunities came back to haunt the hosts when Durán won a penalty after a neat interchange with Ross Barkley, picking himself up to send the ‘keeper the wrong way from the spot. Broggio, Patterson and Jimoh-Aloba entered the fray late on as Emery gave a first taste of senior action to more talented Academy youngsters. Wycombe had the last word on the night, striking in the final minute of stoppage time via Kone. Upcoming Fixtures Ipswich Town Vs. Aston Villa - Sat, Oct 10th 2024, 14:00 Aston Villa Vs. FC Bayern München - Tue, Oct 10th 2024, 19:00 Aston Villa Vs. Manchester United - Sat, Oct 10th 2024, 14:00

arts.ttl: 'He executes that PERFECTLY!' | Buendia header fires Villa into the lead!
arts.sum: Emi Buendia's header fires Aston Villa into the lead against Wycombe Wanderers in the Carabao Cup.

arts.ttl: Aston Villa suffer another injury set-back in Carabao Cup clash with Wycombe Wanderers
arts.sum: Aston Villa have been handed a fresh injury worry as Diego Carlos dropped out of the matchday squad for the Carabao Cup third round clash against Wycombe Wanderers.
